data.current_summary: List all abuse tickets ids that match user provided filters
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of abuse ticket IDs that match the provided filter criteria. Supports filtering by abuse type, domain, status, and date range. Returns an AbuseTicketList containing ticket IDs and pagination information. Use this operation to search for existing abuse reports based on specific criteria.

message: Operation 'createTicket' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Description is missing entirely. Added critical context about abuse type categorization requirements (per API terms), input schema reference, return value, and important side effects regarding duplicate submissions and false positive penalties. This is essential for AI agents to understand categorization importance and submission limits.

data.description_suggestion: Creates a new abuse ticket for reporting suspected abuse. Requires accurate categorization of the abuse type (phishing, malware, spam, etc.) according to API definitions to avoid false positive classification. Accepts AbuseTicketCreateLegacy request body with abuse details and affected URLs. Returns AbuseTicketId containing the newly created ticket ID. Note: Submitting more than 5 URLs per domain may result in duplicate classification and deprioritization per API terms.

data.current_summary: Return the abuse ticket data for a given ticket id
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve abuse ticket details by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information for a specific abuse ticket using its ticket ID. Returns an AbuseTicketLegacy object containing ticket status, abuse type, reported URLs, submission date, and review status. Use this operation to check the current status and details of a previously submitted abuse report.

data.description_suggestion: Creates a new abuse ticket for reporting suspected abuse using the v2 endpoint with improved processing capabilities. Requires accurate categorization of the abuse type (phishing, malware, spam, etc.) according to API definitions to avoid false positive classification. Accepts AbuseTicketCreate request body with abuse details and affected URLs. Returns AbuseTicketId containing the newly created ticket ID. Note: Submitting more than 5 URLs per domain may result in duplicate classification and deprioritization per API terms. False positive rates exceeding 40% may result in report deprioritization.
